result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary D. Beil was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gary D. Beil is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gary D. Beil was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DE may not go upon any Hartwood Forest Land, or any Forest Crop Land, or managed forest land.  DE may not cut, remove, transport or direct the same of any raw forest product, except may transport lawfully harvested boughs. DE may not go upon any county, federal or state land by foot, except DE may go on County, Federal or public land by foot if DE possesses a valid permit.

11:19 AM DA calls cases 16CM50 & 16CM47 and states appearances. Defendant Gary D. Beil appeared with attorney Kristopher R Ellis.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties acknowledge receipt of revocation packet, and waive its reading. Recommendations by DA. Comments by Atty Ellis. Comments by DE. Summation by the Court. Court imposes. 

16CM50
Ct. 1 
75 days jail, jail term is with Huber and is to commence within 30 days of 08/25/2020. - Jail term is cc.
Jail term may be served in any County in the State of WI
Reimpose all prior monetary obligations with credit for payments made.
Ct. 4
75 days jail, jail term is with Huber and is to commence within 30 days of 08/25/2020. - Jail term is cc. 
Jail term may be served in any County in the State of WI
Reimpose all prior monetary obligations with credit for payments made.


16CM47
Ct. 1 
75 days jail, jail term is with Huber and is to commence within 30 days of 08/25/2020. - Jail term is cc of 16CM50.
Jail term may be served in any County in the State of WI
Reimpose all prior monetary obligations with credit for payments made.

DE is given 54 days jail credit.

Pay plan granted $100 a month starting today 08/25/2020 with like payments on or before until paid in full or CO.
DE to pay $100 today.

11:34 AM - DA calls cases 16CM47 and 16CM50 and states appearances. Defendant Gary D. Beil appeared via video from Marathon County jail with attorney Kristopher R Ellis appearing telephonically.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reporter appears by telephone. DA states that DE is awaiting revocation hearing on these matters. DA asks for DE release on a bond. records.addlTxt:
11:01 am - DA calls cases 16CM47 and 16CM50 and states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Gary D. Beil in court with attorney James Richard Lex.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Comments by Atty Lex.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to count 1 in 16CM47, and counts 1 & 4 in 16CM50.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on these counts, and on motion of DA, dismisses but reads in Cts 2 & 3 on 15CM50, and dismisses Ct 2-4 on 16CM47.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  DE to submit DNA sample at PRSO.  Court imposes:

16CM47  Ct 1 -Sentence withheld - 2 years probation
Conditions of probation
$243 cc
$200 DNA
$65 SBDA
10 days jail with huber, cs to any other, with credit for time served (TBD)
DE may not go upon any Hartwood Forest Land, or any Forest Crop Land, or managed forest land.  DE may not cut, remove, transport or direct the same of any raw forest product, except may transport lawfully harvested boughs. DE may not go upon any county, federal or state land by foot, except DE may go on County, Federal or public land by foot if DE possesses a valid permit.

16CM50 Ct 1-Sentence withheld - 2 years probation
Conditions of probation
$243 cc
$200 DNA
$65 SBDA
10 days jail with huber, cs to any other, with credit for time served (TBD)
$1539.56 restitution plus $153.96 surcharge for a total of $1693.52.
DE may not go upon any Hartwood Forest Land, or any Forest Crop Land, or managed forest land.  DE may not cut, remove, transport or direct the same of any raw forest product, except may transport lawfully harvested boughs. DE may not go upon any county, federal or state land by foot, except DE may go on County, Federal or public land by foot if DE possesses a valid permit.

$243 cc

11:14 am - DA calls cases 16CM47 and 16CM50 and states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Gary D. Beil in court with attorney James Richard Lex.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to count 1 in 16CM47, and counts 1 & 4 in 16CM50.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  DE states that he told the truth to the officer.  Court questions DE why he pled no contest.  To be set off to another day for the DE to think about this.
Status conference on June 6, 2017 at 11:00 am.

1:28 pm DA calls cases 16CM47 and 16CM50 and states appearances.  Defendant Gary D. Beil not in court.  Atty James R Lex appears.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA asks for a warrant of $300.  Court asks if Lex has received discovery and he acknowledges.  Court inquires as to Miranda Good Child issues.  Lex to contact his DE regarding this.  Court orders warrant with any prior conditions and orders it held for 5 business days.  Court will wait for Authorization to appear from Lex, and then court will vacate warrant.

Cases 16CM47 and 16CM50.  Defendant Gary D. Beil in court with attorney James Richard Lex for purposes of this hearing.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders warrant quashed.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
